pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.6: _Paṭibhānacittaṃ_. _Citta_ is here equivalent to Sanskrit _citra_, which means colorful, variegated, decorative, etc., and by extension it also means a picture or painting, which seems to be the intended meaning here. _Paṭibhāna_ means something like impromptu imagination. The commentary, [](Sp.4.804.29), specifies that it was a picture of a couple having sexual intercourse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.11: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [](Mv.8.3.1).
